decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells from the Adventure mechanic. By utilizing cards like Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck can generate value and card advantage while pressuring the opponent with creatures like Beanstalk Giant and Lovestruck Beast. The deck also has versatile options with Fae of Wishes and Escape to the Wilds, allowing for flexibility in adapting to different situations. This deck aims to quickly build a board presence and maintain pressure to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by quickly buffing up creatures with enchantments like All That Glitters and Staggering Insight. Using a mix of protection spells like Gods Willing and Karametra's Blessing, it aims to keep its creatures safe while dealing damage. The presence of Season of Growth allows for card draw and more buffs. The deck also includes evasion creatures like Gingerbrute and Stonecoil Serpent, as well as hate cards like Hushbringer to disrupt opponent strategies. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful, quickly growing creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to get key pieces on the board while dealing damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, the deck can quickly amass a threatening board presence. Zenith Flare serves as both a finisher and a way to gain back lost life, making it a versatile tool in the deck. Frostveil Ambush and Boon of the Wish-Giver provide additional options for card draw, ensuring that the deck can consistently keep up the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on using cheap cycling creatures and spells to quickly build up a board presence and deal damage to the opponent. By cycling through cards, the deck can find key pieces like Zenith Flare to finish off the opponent or disrupt their plans with Memory Leak. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger while utilizing cards like Startling Development and Frostveil Ambush to keep the pressure on. The deck aims to close out games quickly with burst damage from Zenith Flare.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy. By leveraging cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to limit the opponent's options and cards like Agent of Treachery to steal their best permanents, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and token generation, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free and control the board with cards like Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery. The companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, provides additional value by flickering permanents for more advantage. With a suite of removal spells and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to stall the game until it can take over with its strong late-game threats. Additionally, Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast provides a way to cheat big creatures into play for added pressure.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils while ramping into big threats with Fires of Invention. The deck also utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional card advantage and value. By maximizing the use of removal spells like Shatter the Sky and countermagic, along with efficient threats like Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol opponents in a long game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn, gaining advantage over the opponent by consistently controlling the board with cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Shatter the Sky. With a high land count and Yorion as a companion, the deck aims to generate value through blink effects and card draw, while also relying on powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient control and card advantage.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn, allowing the player to control the board and outvalue their opponent. By playing cards like Narset, Teferi, and Lukka, the deck can filter through its library, set up powerful plays, and cheat in big threats like Agent of Treachery. The deck also includes a variety of control tools, such as Shark Typhoon and Elspeth Conquers Death, to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free and gain control of the game. It utilizes cards like Agent of Treachery, Shark Typhoon, and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for extra value and recurring threats. The deck aims to stall the game with control spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and card advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing cards like Fires of Invention to quickly cast powerful spells for free. It also includes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and Elspeth Conquers Death are used to bring out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery. The deck aims to stall the game with control elements until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful late-game threats and take control of the board.

This deck aims to control the board by using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. The main win condition is to generate card advantage and tempo through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Shark Typhoon, while also utilizing Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery. The deck also includes various ways to generate tokens and gain life, such as Omen of the Sun and The Birth of Meletis, to stabilize until the late game where it can take over with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with removal and card advantage from cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. The goal is to stall the game until you can resolve big threats like Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and Agent of Treachery to take over the game. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a companion to provide extra value by blinking permanents for additional card advantage and board control. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of control and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with powerful enchantments and planeswalkers while utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn. It aims to stall the game with card draw and token generation until it can overwhelm the opponent with high-value threats like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering permanents for extra ETB effects. The deck's main goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful planning and resource management.

The overall strategy is to maintain control of the game until overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures with haste and powerful abilities to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The goal is to apply pressure early on and maintain a steady stream of threats to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Embercleave and Domri's Ambush provides additional reach and removal options to help close out the game. Additionally, the deck utilizes mana ramp with Temple of Abandon and Stomping Ground to ensure a smooth curve and consistent pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm and outpace the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. It focuses on playing threats quickly, boosting their power with cards like Embercleave and Shadowspear, and dominating the battlefield with creatures like Questing Beast and Shifting Ceratops. The deck also includes some removal spells like Heartless Act and Domri's Ambush to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and quickly finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures with abilities that can deal damage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing the companion Umori to reduce the deck size and only include creature spells, the player can consistently play threats each turn. The Gruul Aggro archetype emphasizes aggressive play and overwhelming the opponent with strong creatures like Questing Beast and God-Eternal Rhonas. By ramping up mana with cards like Marauding Raptor and Arboreal Grazer, the deck aims to control the battlefield and quickly close out the game.

By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's plans and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent over the course of the game. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value and resilience to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through various spells and loyalty abilities of planeswalkers. The deck utilizes Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and Agent of Treachery to steal opponent's creatures and gain control of the battlefield. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering permanents for repeated effects. The mana base enables consistent access to all colors needed for spells and abilities in order to maintain control and outvalue the opponent.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on maintaining board control and disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through card draw and token generation. It utilizes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to control the flow of the game. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to further disrupt the opponent's plans. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast provide a way to bring back or cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery for additional value.

The main idea of this Jeskai Control deck is to maintain control over the board and the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the deck. By utilizing a mix of card draw, board wipes, and efficient threats, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building towards its own win condition, often through incremental advantage and value generation. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements with a mix of shock lands, pathways, and basic lands.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects and card advantage to control the game. By using cards like Trail of Crumbs and Bolas's Citadel to generate card advantage, along with sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Woe Strider to trigger effects like Mayhem Devil, the deck aims to maintain control over the board and out-value opponents. Claim the Firstborn and Priest of Forgotten Gods provide additional ways to disrupt opposing strategies and gain advantages. The deck's mana base allows for consistency in casting spells and activating abilities.

The main focus of this Jund Control deck is to gain control of the game through a combination of sacrifice and value generation. By utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Woe Strider, and Mayhem Devil in conjunction with Trail of Crumbs and Witch's Oven, the deck aims to create a recursive loop of sacrificing and dealing damage to the opponent. This strategy is further supported by Claim the Firstborn for stealing opponent's creatures and Bolas's Citadel for extra card advantage and potential finisher. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of consistency to the deck.

The deck focuses on sacrificing and recurring creatures to gain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's board. It utilizes cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods, Mayhem Devil, and Massacre Girl to control the board while also generating value through Cauldron Familiar and Woe Strider. The deck also has a combo with Witch's Oven and Claim the Firstborn to steal and sacrifice the opponent's creatures. Bolas's Citadel provides another win condition by allowing the player to cast cards from the top of their library. The mana base is built around the Jund colors to support the deck's various strategies.

This Jund Control deck focuses on creating a resource advantage by sacrificing creatures, stealing opponent's creatures, and generating value through card draw and mana ramp. The deck aims to control the board through various combo interactions like sacrificing Cauldron Familiar with Witch's Oven and Mayhem Devil triggers. The main win condition revolves around dealing incremental damage to the opponent's life total while maintaining a solid board presence. The inclusion of Bolas's Citadel allows for explosive plays and potential combo finishes.

The deck focuses on using sacrifice effects to control the board and generate value. By utilizing cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil, the deck can consistently sacrifice creatures for various benefits. Bolas's Citadel provides a powerful late-game finisher, allowing the deck to gain card advantage and potentially close out the game quickly. The main idea of this deck is to control the game by sacrificing creatures and generating value from them. The deck focuses on using cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods, Cauldron Familiar, and Woe Strider to create repeatable sac outlets and trigger abilities that can gain advantage over the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Mayhem Devil and Trail of Crumbs to deal damage and draw cards, respectively. The main concept of this deck is to create a strong board presence through sacrificing creatures and generating value with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Mayhem Devil. The deck revolves around creating a food and sacrifice engine using cards like Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar while controlling the board with removal spells like Claim the Firstborn. Bolas's Citadel can be used as a finisher to close out games quickly. The mana base is built around producing the necessary colors to support the various cards in the deck.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on building a strong board presence early in the game with efficient creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion, Rimrock Knight, and Worthy Knight. The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy by utilizing sacrifice effects like Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main idea of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By using a combination of low-cost creatures with abilities that enhance them, along with auras that boost their power, the goal is to create a fast and powerful board presence.
